derivation: a primitive root; properly, to hide for refuge (but not so precipitately as H2620 (חָסָה));
outline:
1. to trust
    1. (Qal)
      1. to trust, trust in
      2. to have confidence, be confident
      3. to be bold
      4. to be secure
    2. (Hiphil)
      1. to cause to trust, make secure
    3. (TWOT) to feel safe, be careless
kjv_def: be bold (confident, secure, sure), careless (one, woman), put confidence, (make to) hope, (put, make to) trust.
strongs_def: figuratively, to trust, be confident or sure
